extendedInfo.description: Practise standard chords, intervals and key signatures with this simple, no-nonsense music theory reference and quiz. Development supervised by a musicologist.Always free, ad-free version.Reference:* Use treble, bass, tenor, alto, soprano, and baritone clefs.* See chords and key signatures displayed with high quality graphics.* Hear chords played.* Choose any starting note.* Choose chord inversion.* All possible key signatures available.* Standard chords include seventh and augmented sixth chords as well as triads.Quiz:* Test your knowledge and speed with quizzes.* Chords quiz.* Intervals quiz (full version only).* Key signatures quiz (full version only).

reviews.title: Awful!
reviews.comment: Graphics are mostly off-screen, and quiz just lists a bunch of chords--should there be sound to match the possible choices?  No instructions or submenus are given to help--no clues.  In short, either it\'s badly flawed or poorly designed.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: In like this as lot.i studied musical theory 10 years ago, & thought i\'d forgotten most of it, but now i know in can easily revise anytime in like.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very simple
reviews.comment: There isnt really much to this app, which IS what it claimed, so dont go looking for anything advanced. I found that it works well and will probably use it for reference but i wont use the quiz portion.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Useless
reviews.comment: What is this app supposed to do? It just shows a cut, blurred page.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Doesn\'t work well on tablet
reviews.comment: Screen doesn\'t do well in landscape on a Xoom.  Can\'t see most of the  buttons in learning mode.  Also, there\'s little path from randomly staring at the chords to doing the quiz... would be better broken down into progressive lessons.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: The major-minor seventh chord should be the same as a dominant seventh. This needs to be corrected!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Sucks
reviews.comment: There are better designed apps out there than this. Uninstall.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not responding
reviews.comment: It doesnt play the note and crashes each time i click it

reviews.comment: @david I think italian is b6-1-#4, french is b6-1-2-#4 and German is b6-1-b3-#4 great app BTW but should explain!

reviews.comment: Would prefer the answer to the current chord be shown at the end of the quiz with the chord still visible. Also: minor-major, not major-minor.

reviews.comment: I know this shows my lack of knowledge, but I couldn\'t find a good explanation of French/Italian/German 6ths

reviews.comment: It would b nice to have inversions but its a great app for learning and keeping up with music theory

reviews.comment: Here\'s a suggestion: play the chord all together after it plays the notes of the chord.

reviews.comment: Haven\'t even tried it yet but free app with no ads plus no permissions...even if it sucks it deserves 4*s for that...I\'ll be back with #5 if its half way usable as well
